executable.title: Spherical Harmonics Power
executable.description:
Power of a spherical function represented by SH basis.
\ Examples: 
\ SHCoefficientsPower odf.nii.gz odf_power.nii.gz --power 2.0 
\ Reference: 
\ Jian Cheng, Rachid Deriche, Tianzi Jiang, Dinggang Shen, Pew-Thian Yap, "Non-Negative Spherical Deconvolution (NNSD) for estimation of fiber Orientation Distribution Function in single-/multi-shell diffusion MRI", NeuroImage, vol. 101, pp. 750â€“764, 2014.

image.name: _InputFile
image.label: Input SH Coefficient File
image.description: Vector image that contains the SH coefficients.

image.name: _OutputFile
image.label: Output SH Coefficient File
image.description: Vector image that will contain the rotated SH coefficients.

double.name: _Power
double.description: Power argument. If the power is 2, we have closed form. For other power number, we use a numerical fitting of the powered spherical function.

integer.name: _SHRank
integer.description: SH Rank for output SH coefficients. It is needed for refitting if the power is not 2 or 1. If not set, it is set as the rank of the input SH image.

integer.name: _NumberOfThreads
integer.description: Number of threads. If it not positive, then the default number for multiple threads is used.
